Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery type A cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; top of rim glazed; exterior: black band near top of rim; black-figure decoration consisting of part of two chariot horses (added red on mane and collar; far horse in added white) to right; on the far side, bearded charioteer (long white chiton, Boeotian shield on back), to right, possibly adjusting harness.
Curator's comments: According to Venit, the sherd is probably made by the same hand and perhaps comes from the same cup as British Museum 1886,0401.1202 (Venit 1982, 448, no. B742), which was found in the area of the Sanctuary of Apollo. Should both sherds belong to the same vase, then it is likely that British Museum 1888,0601.594.e was found in the same area.
Curvature and thickness are mildly different from those of 1886,0401.1202
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.33)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 448, no. B742) (incorrectly labelled 1888,0601.594.c)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0623) (Phase 1)
